summary: Build “The Cool Down,” an AI stress-response app with a calming dark-mode dashboard, real-time BPM monitoring, BPM-triggered lockout, guided breathing intervention, and an anger-text “shield” UI with soothing animations and minimalist styling.
architectural_notes: Use Framer Motion for smooth, de-escalating UI transitions and animations.
Core state should be driven by real-time BPM input to trigger lockout and interventions.

existing_features.title: Create the Dashboard screen in a calming dark-mode UI that shows a real-time BPM line graph and includes a “Stimulate Anger Spike” button that simulates a temporary BPM increase for testing.
Implement trigger logic: when BPM exceeds 100, enter an unskippable “Lockout Mode” for 30 seconds, blocking normal interactions until the timer completes.

Build the Intervention UI shown during escalation/lockout that displays a pulsing Box Breathing animation with a 4-second inhale, 4-second hold, and 4-second exhale loop, plus a visible 10-second countdown.

Add the “Rage text shield” section: a text area where users can type their anger and a “Dissolve” button that clears the text using a cloud-like dissolve animation instead of sending the text anywhere.

Apply a minimalist visual style across the app using a dark mode palette of blues and forest greens, and implement smooth, de-escalating transitions using Framer Motion for screen/overlay changes and key UI animations.
Add optional, user-toggleable audio cues that guide the Box Breathing phases (inhale, hold, exhale, hold) during the lockout Intervention UI, without changing the existing 4-second phase timing.
Provide an in-UI control on the lockout overlay to enable/disable breathing audio cues, with clear English labels and a visible enabled/disabled state.
Handle browser autoplay restrictions by requiring an explicit user gesture before starting breathing audio, and ensure the app fails gracefully (no crashes) if audio cannot be started.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create Dashboard with calming dark-mode UI and real-time BPM graph
Add “Stimulate Anger Spike” test button to simulate elevated BPM
Implement trigger logic: when BPM > 100, enter unskippable 30-second Lockout Mode
Build Intervention screen with pulsing Box Breathing animation (4s inhale/hold/exhale) plus 10s countdown
Add “Rage text shield”: text area for typing anger with a Dissolve button that clears text using a cloud animation
Apply minimalist visual style (blues + forest greens) with smooth de-escalating transitions using Framer Motion
Add optional audio cues to guide the box-breathing cycle during the intervention (e.g., inhale/hold/exhale cues)
